meanings.definition: To surpass in storytelling or creating a fictional narrative.
meanings.sent1: She outfabled her friends with her imaginative tales.
meanings.sent2: The author outfabled all others with her captivating story.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they tried to outfable each other with wild stories.
meanings.sent4: His ability to outfable reality made him a master storyteller.
meanings.sent5: Her storytelling skills were so strong that she could outfable anyone in the room.

meanings.definition: To outdo in the realm of imagination or storytelling.
meanings.sent1: The movie outfabled all expectations with its stunning visuals.
meanings.sent2: Their creativity in the project outfabled the competition.
meanings.sent3: The students laughed as they tried to outfable each other's wild ideas.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams could outfable even the most fantastical stories.
meanings.sent5: The artist's work was so imaginative that it could outfable reality itself.
